etymology.interpretation: Combines a person with a cow, evoking a person handling or counting livestock. By extension, it came to denote an individual item or case and is now widely used as a classifier, especially for clothing and matters.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服很合适(這件衣服很合適)。
examples.english: This piece of clothing fits well.

examples.chinese: 我今天有三件事要做(我今天有三件事要做)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīntiān yǒu sān jiàn shì yào zuò.
examples.english: I have three things to do today.

examples.chinese: 这台机器少了一件零部件(這臺機器少了一件零部件)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tái jīqì shǎo le yī jiàn língbùjiàn.
examples.english: This machine is missing a component.
